pages.text: The air gets colder the higher you go. Keeping to the mountain tops is a slow-going but effective way to stay cool while you travel!$(br2)Sprinting overheats and dehydrates you quickly. Spend most of your time walking unless there's an emergency.
Burning up with hyperthermia? Get underground! The more blocks above you, the cooler you'll be.$(br2)You need at least an 11x11 roof with 3m of clearance to create enough shade to cool you.
Some blocks increase or decrease the temperature around them.$(br2)Anything visibly burning will make you hotter; water, ice, snow, and deciduous leaves will cool you down.
